ch.ethz.csb.youscope.shared.measurement
Interface Measurement

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
public interface Measurement
extends java.rmi.Remote

Represents a measurement a microscope should do.

Author:
Moritz Lang

Method Summary
 void addFinishDeviceSetting(DeviceSettingDTO setting)
          Adds a device settings which should be applied (once) the measurement ends.
 void addMeasurementListener(MeasurementListener listener)
          Adds a listener which is notified about the state of the measurement.

          Adds a new task to the measurement so that at times {startTime, startTime + periods[0], startTime + periods[0] + periods[1], ..., startTime + sum_{i=0:size-2}(periods[i]), startTime + sum_{i=0:size-1}(periods[i]) + breakTime, startTime + sum_{i=0:size-1}(periods[i]) + breakTime + periods[0]} the jobs of the task will be executed.

          Stops the execution of the calling thread until the measurement is finished.
 

Method Detail

isRunning

boolean isRunning()
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returns if measurement is currently running or not.

Returns:
True if measurement is running, false otherwise.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

java.lang.String getName()
                         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returns human readable name of the measurement.

Returns:
Human readable name of the measurement.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

setName

void setName(java.lang.String name)
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                    MeasurementRunningException
Sets human readable name of the measurement.

Parameters:
name - Human readable name. If null, old name will be kept.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
MeasurementRunningException

getState

MeasurementState getState()
                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returns the current state of the measurement.

Returns:
Current state.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

startMeasurement

void startMeasurement()
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Starts the execution of the measurement. Note: If other measurements are already running, the measurement gets queued.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

stopMeasurement

void stopMeasurement()
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Stops the execution of the measurement after all queued jobs were finished. Note: If measurement is queued, it gets disabled but not un-queued.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

waitForMeasurementFinish

void waitForMeasurementFinish()
                              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Stops the execution of the calling thread until the measurement is finished.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

interruptMeasurement

void interruptMeasurement()
                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Interrupts the execution of the measurement. All queued jobs are discarded.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

addMeasurementListener

void addMeasurementListener(MeasurementListener listener)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Adds a listener which is notified about the state of the measurement.

Parameters:
listener - Listener which should be notified.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

void removeMeasurementListener(MeasurementListener listener)
                               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Removes a previously added listener.

Parameters:
listener - The listener to remove.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

setRuntime

void setRuntime(int measurementRuntime)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                       MeasurementRunningException
Sets the runtime of the measurement.

Parameters:
measurementRuntime - Runtime of the measurement in milliseconds. Set to -1 for an infinite runtime.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
MeasurementRunningException

getRuntime

int getRuntime()
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returns the runtime of the measurement.

Returns:
Runtime of the measurement. A value of -1 corresponds to an infinite runtime.

java.rmi.RemoteException

                                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                          MeasurementRunningException

lock - True if should be locked.

                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                              MeasurementRunningException

type - Type identifier.

                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException

java.rmi.RemoteException

addTask

MeasurementTask addTask(int period,
                        boolean fixedTimes,
                        int startTime)
                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                               MeasurementRunningException
Adds a new task to the measurement so that at times ( + i * ) ms, i = 0,1,2,..., the jobs of the task will be executed. Same as addTask(period, fixedTimes, startTime, -1).

Parameters:
period - Time between single executions (in milliseconds).
fixedTimes - TRUE if jobs should be done at fixed time intervals, FALSE if job may be delayed if microscope runs slow.
startTime - The time when the jobs are started first (in ms).
Returns:
The newly created task. If not successful, NULL is returned.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
MeasurementRunningException

addTask

MeasurementTask addTask(int period,
                        boolean fixedTimes,
                        int startTime,
                        int numExecutions)
                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                               MeasurementRunningException
Adds a new task to the measurement so that at times ( + i * ) ms, i = 0,1,2,..., the jobs of the task will be executed. After executions of the task, the task won't be scheduled anymore

Parameters:
period - Time between single executions (in milliseconds).
fixedTimes - TRUE if jobs should be done at fixed time intervals, FALSE if job may be delayed if microscope runs slow.
startTime - The time when the jobs are started first (in ms).
numExecutions - Maximal number of executions. -1 for an infinite amount.
Returns:
The newly created task. If not successful, NULL is returned.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
MeasurementRunningException

addMultiplePeriodTask

MeasurementTask addMultiplePeriodTask(int[] periods,
                                      int breakTime,
                                      int startTime)
                                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                             MeasurementRunningException
Adds a new task to the measurement so that at times {startTime, startTime + periods[0], startTime + periods[0] + periods[1], ..., startTime + sum_{i=0:size-2}(periods[i]), startTime + sum_{i=0:size-1}(periods[i]) + breakTime, startTime + sum_{i=0:size-1}(periods[i]) + breakTime + periods[0]} the jobs of the task will be executed. Same as addMultiplePeriodTask(periods, breakTime, startTime, -1).

Parameters:
periods - Times between single executions (in milliseconds).
breakTime - After all periods are run through, the job will pause for ms and then start with periods[0] again.
startTime - The time when the jobs should be started first (in ms).
Returns:
The newly created task. If not successful, NULL is returned.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
MeasurementRunningException

addMultiplePeriodTask

MeasurementTask addMultiplePeriodTask(int[] periods,
                                      int breakTime,
                                      int startTime,
                                      int numExecutions)
                                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                             MeasurementRunningException
Adds a new task to the measurement so that at times {startTime, startTime + periods[0], startTime + periods[0] + periods[1], ..., startTime + sum_{i=0:size-2}(periods[i]), startTime + sum_{i=0:size-1}(periods[i]) + breakTime, startTime + sum_{i=0:size-1}(periods[i]) + breakTime + periods[0]} the jobs of the task will be executed.

Parameters:
periods - Times between single executions (in milliseconds).
breakTime - After all periods are run through, the job will pause for ms and then start with periods[0] again.
startTime - The time when the jobs should be started first (in ms).
numExecutions - Maximal number of executions. -1 for an infinite amount.
Returns:
The newly created task. If not successful, NULL is returned.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
MeasurementRunningException

getTasks

MeasurementTask[] getTasks()
                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returns a list of all tasks of this measurement.

Returns:
List of tasks.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

                                     MeasurementRunningException
